results.title: Co-operative behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
Co-operative behaviour enables groups of people to achieve a common goal. Firstly, a common goal must be decided on, and then behaviour co-ordinated between individuals to achieve this goal. Looks at co-operative behaviour in the classroom, and warns against confusing conformity and obedience with co-operation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and FilmFair Communications

results.title: Closing behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and University of Southern California
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
An introduction to various sorts of closing behaviour often used by the classroom teacher - shifting attention from one child to another, not listening fully to the child’s response - the film points out that too much closing behaviour prevents children developing.

results.title: Aggressive behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
Aggression is a concentrated, focussed reaction to lack of security and approval. Within the classroom aggression on the part of teachers can take the form of verbal abuse, stridency and belittling techniques to satisfy the teacher’s need for security at the expense of pupils. The film shows that pupils can respond to this behaviour by aggression in return or by withdrawal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and FilmFair Communications

results.title: Meeting in progress
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 8 of a series of films for managers. Demonstrates two exercises designed to improve managers’ listening and interactive skills. Viewers can participate in the second exercise which involves attempting to follow a set of instructions and shows the problems of communication without feedback. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Territorial rights
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 7 of a series of films for managers. Examines the reasons why so many misunderstandings occur between specialists and the “line” managers they advise. A film of an argument between a production manager and a services engineer is used as the basis for a discussion between personnel, finance and works managers, and consultants on the sources of interdepartmental problems. Introduced by Brian Redhead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Interview with the boss
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 5 of a series of films for managers. Discusses ways in which employer and employee can develop a working relationship. Documents an appraisal interview at IBM which is replayed to the supervisor and staff member who then discuss their reactions. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Selection interview. No. 3
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 4 of a series of films for managers. Based on a management selection interview, mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. Shows the selection panel’s final assessment of the candidate. Includes a review of the exercise. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Selection interview. No. 2
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 3 of a series fo films for managers. Based on a management selection interview mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. Contains a planned break in the interview, during which the candidate and a selection panel make their interim assessments of each other’s performance. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 2 of a series of films for managers. Based on a management selection interview, mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. The candidate and the selection panel prepare their strategy and tactics for the interview and come together for the first time. Introduced by Brian Redhead.
